required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Attachment and Biobehavioral Catch-up and Depression Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of an Integrated Intervention to Treat Maternal Depression and Children's Behavior Problems: A Transactional Perspective

brief_summary.textblock: Maternal depression influences the development of children's behavior problems and vice versa; however most interventions singularly address maternal depression or children's behavior problems rather than both. This project assesses the efficacy of an intervention that treats both mothers and children in an integrated manner. Effects are expected to disrupt the reciprocal relations that perpetuate maternal and child mental health problems over time.

detailed_description.textblock:
The proposed project is a pilot randomized controlled trial to evaluate the effectiveness of an integrated intervention that dually treats maternal depressive symptoms and offspring behavior problems. Families (n = 40 mothers and their 2-to-4 year-old children) will be randomized to receive 10 sessions of ABC or 10 sessions of ABC+D in their home. ABC+D is an expanded version of ABC that additionally treats maternal depressive symptoms using Mothers and Babies adapted for mothers of toddlers. The specific aims of this proposed project are:
Aim 1. Collect preliminary data on the feasibility and acceptability of ABC+D in preparation for a small pilot randomized controlled trial (RCT).
Aim 2. Conduct a small pilot RCT to examine the effectiveness of ABC and ABC+D
Aim 3: Assess the overall acceptability (mother- and provider-rated), appropriateness (mother- and provider-rated), and feasibility (provider-rated) of ABC+D. Mothers will also rate their satisfaction with each session and the degree to which it was helpful, interesting, and comprehensible.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to post-intervention, an anticipated average of 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 60 with higher values indicating more severe symptoms

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Early Childhood Screening Assessment score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to post-intervention, an anticipated average of 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Scores range from 0 to 72 with higher values indicating more severe symptoms

arm_group.description: Attachment and Biobehavioral Catch-up, 10 weekly sessions that provide parenting support
Attachment and Biobehavioral Catch-up plus weekly 5-10 minute videos that additional provide support for mothers' mood, stress, and coping

intervention.description: ABC is delivered by a trained parent coach. The parent coach provides information about parenting and child development. The focus is on providing support for parents of young children and improving the parent-child relationship.

intervention.intervention_name: Attachment and Biobehavioral Catch up Plus Depression Treatment
intervention.description: ABC+D offers the same 10-sessions of parenting support that is provided by ABC and additionally provides weekly short videos that help mothers develop skills for coping with stress and regulating mood.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Mothers 18 years of age or older with heightened depressive symptoms as determined by a score of 16 or higher on the Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale-Revised (CESD-R)
2. Biological children (of mothers described above) between 2 and 4 years old with heightened behavior problems as determined by a score of 18 or higher on the Early Childhood Screening Assessment (ECSA)
3. English- or Spanish-speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Self-reported history of psychosis or active suicidality as defined by self-report of a specific suicide plan or recent attempt

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared via the NIMH Data Archive (NDA)
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data from this clinical trial require significant processing after the completion of data collection. We will submit a clean dataset after the final data lock.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers will the appropriate qualifications can request the dataset via the NIMH Data Archive Platform.
